Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cm-p1 (natural AMPs; mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, marine invertebrates, animals; Derivatives: Cm-p5)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B. cinerea (MIC 20 uM), F. oxysporum (MIC 20 uM), A. niger (MIC 41 uM), C. albicans 01U or 38U (MIC 7-13 uM), C.parapsilosis (MIC 105 uM), C.neoformans (MIC 209 uM), and T. rubrum (MIC 3 uM).Toxicity: hRBC: not hemo.lytic (not shown). Not toxic to RAW 264.7 cells at 200 or 400 ug/ml.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the structureherein the PDB.Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: López-Abarrategui C, Alba A, Silva ON, Reyes-Acosta O, Vasconcelos IM, Oliveira JT, Migliolo L, Costa MP, Costa CR, Silva MR, Garay HE, Dias SC, Franco OL, Otero-González AJ.2012
Literature Information.Title: Functional characterization of a synthetic hydrophilic antifungal peptide derived from the marine snail Cenchritis muricatus.
